subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] we have a hard row to hoe

Frank,
 
This only becomes an issue when new people get interested in our =
research and seek information from the usual paranormal community and are m=
et with these type of answers and explanations. They quickly become disinte=
rested and whenever anyone may mention box research in the future they conv=
ey the same closed minded ignorance that was spewed to them on their initia=
l quest for answers.
 
Not to mention that anyone that does any serious res=
earch in this medium would I'm sure like to have their efforts recognised a=
s being legitimate in their source and taken seriously with respect. not  d=
ismissed as nonsense or something that is written off as fake or delusional=
. 
 
Frank I don't want to start a long thread with all different people sn=
iping back and forth I posted that snip it of a blog to let everyone know w=
hat the general consensus of our research is. And I did not even mention wh=
o the blog was actually about but I'm sure we all can guess. It's that kind=
 of stupidity that stops us from getting new potential researchers involved=
 and adding their positive energy to our own, I have received messages from=
 our friends on the other side that instruct that the more individuals that=
 are involved and think positively about the communication we are striving =
to achieve, the stronger the communication will get. I view this blog attit=
ude as not a personal attack on what I am particularly doing but just anoth=
er extremely large hurtle to get over in bringing this amazing form of spir=
it communication to the forefront of paranormal research.
 
Bruce
Bruce Hal=
liday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: warrior18eii@...: Mon, =
31 Dec 2007 05:18:29 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] we have a hard row to hoe
=






Why would this be an issue? I am not doing this to convince others of=
 the validity of my messages. If someone wants to learn how, I will teach t=
hem. If someone has questions I will answer them to the best of my ability.=
 If someone is skeptical it is a distraction from my goals to try and convi=
nce them that something is real. Its pointless to try and convince or prove=
 the reality of a practice that is so highly subjective and mostly personal=
.Regards,Frank R.
----- Original Message ----From: bhali333 <paranormalinve=
stigating@...>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comSent: Sunday, December 30,=
 2007 3:18:44 PMSubject: [EVP-ITC] we have a hard row to hoe

This statemen=
t was taken from a blog that was sent to me by steve. He came across it whi=
le web surfing.It is indicitive of the attitude 90% of the paranormal commu=
nity has toward box evp research.I suggest we all memorise it because as bo=
x researchers this will be our most formitable object.The first thought tha=
t comes to mind about this whole 'box' thing is what are the chances that s=
pirits would comunicate through such a box. I mean there are so many differ=
ent radio frequencies the chances that anything would or would want to use =
the am or fm bands seems very unlikely. Bruce
